channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-5866] Unable to load password protected pdf
item.description:
PDFBox is unable to load password protected pdf. Error is "Invalid AES key length: 48 bytes."

Adobe and qpdf are able to successfully open it , but many other applications I've tried are unable to do so.

The pdf is created by a third party scanner so unfortunately we have no insight/control over its creation. 

pdfbox_invalid_pwd.pdf . Please let me know the best way to provide the password.
item.summary: Unable to load password protected pdf

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: send it to tilman at snafu dot de

Exception in thread "main" java.io.IOException: java.security.InvalidKeyException: Invalid AES key length: 48 bytes
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.encryption.StandardSecurityHandler.validatePerms(StandardSecurityHandler.java:355)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.encryption.StandardSecurityHandler.prepareForDecryption(StandardSecurityHandler.java:296)

at org.apache.pdfbox.Loader.loadPDF(Loader.java:282)

Caused by: java.security.InvalidKeyException: Invalid AES key length: 48 bytes
at java.base/com.sun.crypto.provider.AESCrypt.init(AESCrypt.java:90)
at java.base/com.sun.crypto.provider.ElectronicCodeBook.init(ElectronicCodeBook.java:97)
at java.base/com.sun.crypto.provider.CipherCore.init(CipherCore.java:591)
at java.base/com.sun.crypto.provider.CipherCore.init(CipherCore.java:467)
at java.base/com.sun.crypto.provider.AESCipher.engineInit(AESCipher.java:313)
at java.base/javax.crypto.Cipher.implInit(Cipher.java:837)
at java.base/javax.crypto.Cipher.chooseProvider(Cipher.java:899)
at java.base/javax.crypto.Cipher.init(Cipher.java:1284)
at java.base/javax.crypto.Cipher.init(Cipher.java:1221)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.encryption.StandardSecurityHandler.validatePerms(StandardSecurityHandler.java:327)

I tried changing this code

cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, new SecretKeySpec(getEncryptionKey(), "AES"));

to

cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, new SecretKeySpec(Arrays.copyOf(getEncryptionKey(), 32), "AES"));

just to see what would happen, and now this happened:

2 0 obj

file that works:

5 0 obj
<<
/Filter /Standard
/V 5
/R 5
/Length 256
/P -64
/O <B91ECC1D3889CBEC29C14220BDE4D678B227CE29757BCC787161B939743867716BEC51313B63D8D82BDC4D91F3D8FDC2>
/U <0D48CD96A1A3859C5F361908A235ABC9B2D773C72C9360667152CAD0D9B2A9133BF852013252C5DDA0848D8163C20C9D>

/UE <D91E0E55F6A11E21340E1AEC716232CECE8615170B811F4DF6D20ED6D12C0B36>
/Perms <644CB0197232270E265A984BB5D70886>
/EncryptMetadata true
/CF <</StdCF <</AuthEvent /DocOpen /CFM /AESV3 /Length 32>>>>
/StmF /StdCF /StrF /StdCF
>>
endobj
13 0 obj
<< /Nums [0 << /S /D >>
] >>

endobj

This code change fixes it:

        if (dicRevision == REVISION_5 || dicRevision == REVISION_6)
        {
            passwordCharset = StandardCharsets.UTF_8;
            ue = Arrays.copyOf(encryption.getUserEncryptionKey(), 32);
            oe = Arrays.copyOf(encryption.getOwnerEncryptionKey(), 32);
        }

Of course that's all dumb and brute force, I'll have to find out why this works and read the spec 😂

Update: the spec mentions 32 bytes.

Commit 1919766 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919766 ]

PDFBOX-5866: truncate at 32 bytes

Commit 1919767 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919767 ]

PDFBOX-5866: truncate at 32 bytes

Commit 1919768 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/branches/3.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919768 ]

PDFBOX-5866: truncate at 32 bytes

It should work now. Thanks for submitting this. Your file has nothing confidential so consider posting the password here unless it's used elsewhere (if so then maybe I should delete your mail?). Snapshot builds are or will be available here:
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox-app/3.0.4-SNAPSHOT/
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox-app/2.0.33-SNAPSHOT/

The build test failure in the examples subproject isn't because of the change, I verified this. I'll investigate this separately.
Update: likely a certificate problem with https://www.pki.admin.ch .
As an aside, I've seen documents from the wild in which the O and U entries were longer than anticipated. Thus, you may also want to cut those entries down to their correct lengths.

Commit 1919782 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919782 ]

PDFBOX-5866: also truncate the O and U entries, as suggested by Michael Klink

Commit 1919783 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919783 ]

PDFBOX-5866: also truncate the O and U entries, as suggested by Michael Klink

Commit 1919784 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/branches/3.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919784 ]

PDFBOX-5866: also truncate the O and U entries, as suggested by Michael Klink

Great!

I see you only covered revisions <= 4 and == 6. Does PDFBox support revision == 5, the algorithm from an Adobe developer extension to ISO 32000-1? Then you could also find an expected length for that case.
I didn't look because I looked only at the ISO document, which didn't mention 5, so I left that one untouched. But yes, the "adobe_supplement_iso32000.pdf" mentions it, so I'll add that as well.

Commit 1919807 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1919807 ]

PDFBOX-5866: also truncate the O and U entries for R == 5, as suggested by Michael Klink

Commit 1919808 from Tilman Hausherr in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'

PDFBOX-5866: also truncate the O and U entries for R == 5, as suggested by Michael Klink
